comments:
I am using an RCP application and trying to debug using the "Use features in 
workspace" option for the launch configration.  When I tried to import the 
plug-ins my app needed using the Import "External Plug-ins and Fragments" 
wizzard I choose to Import As "Binary projects with linked content" but when I 
ran the app I got the following in the log:

!SESSION ----------------------------------------------------------------------
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.launcher 4 0 Feb 28, 2004 07:39:00.924
!MESSAGE Exception launching the Eclipse Platform:
!STACK
java.io.FileNotFoundException: 
P:\MyAppWorkspace\plugins\org.eclipse.osgi\eclipse.properties (The system 
cannot find the file specified)
	at java.io.FileInputStream.open(Native Method)
	at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(FileInputStream.java:103)
	at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(FileInputStream.java:66)
	at sun.net.www.protocol.file.FileURLConnection.connect
(FileURLConnection.java:69)
	at sun.net.www.protocol.file.FileURLConnection.getInputStream
(FileURLConnection.java:156)
	at java.net.URL.openStream(URL.java:960)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.load(Main.java:984)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.loadProperties(Main.java:956)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.addBaseJars(Main.java:385)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.getDevPath(Main.java:378)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.getBootPath(Main.java:445)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:268)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:742)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:581)

That missing file appears in the project explorer with a link symbol on it but 
it is not in the file system.  When I deleted the imported plug-ins and 
reimported them using Import As "Binary projects" everthing is fine and the 
app runs.

Feature-based self-hosting requires that you import all the plug-ins and 
features into  your workspace *without* linking. 
Check the Tips and Tricks section of the PDE Help content.

we are currently investigation how/if feature-based self-hosting can be made 
easier, but for now, these are the rules of engagement.

Ok that is fine if those are the rules those are the rules.  However the UI 
should not make it easy for cutomers to do the wrong thing.  I found the help 
on this topic wanting.  I could not find help initially and had to be refered 
to the tricks and tips section by someone on the forum.  I certainly missed 
the fact that importing with linking was not supported.  At the very least 
there should be a full topic devoted to this feature.  Better would be to help 
customers not make the mistake by changing the UI or adding more information 
in the import wizzard.

traces.message: P:\MyAppWorkspace\plugins\org.eclipse.osgi\eclipse.properties (The system  cannot find the file specified)
